body_html:
@sergiubuciumas
Maybe Python 3.6 should be already installed in your PC. I tried with python3.6 also but it wprks too.
What I did was:
(Installed gpu driver and cuda and rebooted the PC)

  1. Installed Tensorflow-gpu (and cuda8.0)
  2. Installed cudnn.
  3. Installed mkl-dnn.
    (Here I got the libmklml error)
  4. Uninstalled tensorflow-gpu
    sudo python3.6 -m pip uninstall tensorflow-gpu
  5. Installed the tensorflow again and rebooted the PC.
    sudo python3.6 -m pip install tensorflow-gpu
  6. The error was gone.
    I'm not sure this work for you too.

body:
@sergiubuciumas
Maybe Python 3.6 should be already installed in your PC. I tried with python3.6 also but it wprks too.
What I did was:
(Installed gpu driver and cuda and rebooted the PC)
1. Installed Tensorflow-gpu (and cuda8.0)
2. Installed cudnn.
3. Installed mkl-dnn. 
(Here I got the libmklml error)
4. Uninstalled tensorflow-gpu
sudo python3.6 -m pip uninstall tensorflow-gpu
5. Installed the tensorflow again and rebooted the PC.
sudo python3.6 -m pip install tensorflow-gpu
6. The error was gone.
I'm not sure this work for you too.
